# b00tl3gRSA2

## Objetivo
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18243`.

## Pistas

| No. Pistas | Pista                |
| ---------- | -------------------- |
| 1          | What is e generally? |

## Solucion
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/Documentos/crypto/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18243  
c: 
n: 
e: 
                                                                                  
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/Documentos/crypto/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ python3
Python 3.11.4 (main, Jun  7 2023, 10:13:09) [GCC 12.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> c = 
>>> n = 
>>> d = 
>>> e = 65537
>>> m = pow(c,d,n)
>>> m

>>> from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'/\xbf\xd9N\xdc/\xb75\xddMZu\xc0VfV\xac!kShB\xa0\x04\xdakA\x8b\rW\xb5\xcf\xb8?F\xa5\xe3\x00\x80\xd5\xba\xb0\rA\xd4\x8cjn\x88\x1a!\xe6\xfb\xaa\x13\n\xaa\x89a>\xca\xc1B\xf4\x8b\x82\xfa\x8f\x8fF\xc1\xac\x85Dw\x1f\x89\xb3\x886e\xe4-*\xe3\xbd\x17Ugr?\t\x95K?,}F\x1b\xd3\x02\xc6\xc2\xdc\xb9\xc6\xb7*\x11>\xdb\x07\xfa3\x85\x8f\x19-F\xacI\x9a\xd2\x87\xc5\x07\xec;'
>>> m = pow(c,e,n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653466129492033745533
>>>  
>>> long_to_bytes(m)
b'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_4783252}'

```
